source_sentence: 佛說大般泥洹經卷第一
translation: Foshuo dafan nirvāṇa jing, vol. 1

source_sentence: 東晉平陽沙門法顯譯
translation: Translated by the translator Faxian, a monk of Pingyang in the Eastern Jin dynasty

source_sentence: 序品第一
translation: Preface Chapter 1

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛在拘夷城力士生地，熙連河側堅固林雙樹間，與八百億比丘前後圍繞。
translation: Thus I have heard. One time the Buddha was staying at Kuśinagara, in the town of Kuśinagara, surrounded by eighty-eight myriad koṭis of bhikṣus, one behind the other, between two pairs of śāla trees on the bank of the Hiraṇyavatī River.

source_sentence: 二月十五日臨般泥洹，時諸眾生各各悅樂，自計清淨無疑厭想，忽自覺悟：「今日如來、應供、等正覺，
translation: On the fifteenth day of the second month, when he was about to enter final nirvana, all the sentient beings were each delighted and conceived themselves as pure and free from doubt. Suddenly they awakened and thought: Today the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One, is approaching enlightenment.

source_sentence: 哀愍世間覆護世間為世間歸，等觀眾生如視一子，恬淡寂滅大牟尼尊，
translation: With pity for the world that covers the world and protects it as a worldly refuge, he observes all sentient beings equally as if they were looking at his only child, the great sage of peace and tranquility, the Great Sage.

source_sentence: 告諸眾生今當滅度，諸有疑難皆應來問，為最後問。」
translation: He tells all sentient beings that they will now be liberated, and those who have doubts or difficulties should come to ask questions, which is the final question.

source_sentence: 如是覺已各懷憂慼。
translation: After awakening in this way, they each harbor grief.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊從其面門放種種光，青黃赤白頗梨紅色，明耀殊特普照三千大千世界乃至十方一切佛土，
translation: The Bhagavat then emanated various rays of light from the pores of his face, blue, yellow, red, white, crystal, and crimson, shining brilliantly and distinctively, illuminating all the buddha-lands of the ten directions throughout the great manifold cosmos.

source_sentence: 六趣眾生其蒙光者，罪垢諸惱皆悉除滅，咸皆悲慟淚下如雨，更相謂言：「怪哉仁者世間虛空，
translation: The sentient beings in the six destinies who had been illumined were all freed from their sins, dirt, and afflictions, and wept with grief like rain. They said to each other, “How strange it is, my dear friend!

source_sentence: 怪哉仁者眾生福盡，怪哉仁者苦法增長，如來不久當般泥洹；
translation: How wonderful, my dear friend, that the blessings of sentient beings have run out. How wonderful, my dear friend, that the law of suffering increases and that the Tathagata will soon enter final nirvalJa.

source_sentence: 一何駃哉世間虛空，一何駃哉世間眼滅，我等當共疾往詣佛禮拜供養，
translation: How shameful is the space of the world! How shameful is the disappearance of the divine vision of the world! We should together go quickly to see, venerate, and make offerings to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 勸請世尊不般泥洹，住壽一劫若過一劫，若佛泥洹誰為我等親善慈導？
translation: If the Bhagavān doesn't enter nirvāṇa, and if he abides for an eon or more than an eon, who will be our guide of goodness and kindness if he enters nirvāṇa?

source_sentence: 誰為我等救諸厄難？
translation: Who will save us from our troubles and difficulties?

source_sentence: 是故仁等，有所不了當詣如來諮決所疑。」
translation: Therefore, if you don't understand anything, you should go to the Tathāgata to consult and resolve your doubts.

source_sentence: 爾時大地六種震動，時八百億比丘皆阿羅漢心得自在，所作已辦離諸煩惱，
translation: At the time, the earth shook in six ways, and then eight billion monks were all arhats with unimpeded minds, free of afflictions as soon as they had done what they did.

source_sentence: 降伏諸根譬如大龍，成就空慧逮得己利，如栴檀林以為眷屬，功德具足為佛真子。
translation: He subdues the faculties like a great dragon who accomplishes the wisdom of emptiness and acquires its own benefits, serves as his retinue in a sandalwood forest, and is fully endowed with merit as the true child of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 其名曰：尊者迦旃延，尊者薄拘羅，尊者優波難陀等，是諸比丘晨用楊枝澡漱清淨。
translation: Their names were: Venerable Kātyāyana, Venerable Bakkula, Venerable Upananda, and so forth. These bhikṣus washed and purified themselves with tooth sticks in the morning [to cleanse their bodies].

source_sentence: 時有妙光來照其身，如日初出照青樹葉赤脈悉現，此諸比丘亦復如是，
translation: Like the first ray of light that emerges from the sun at the beginning of the day and illumines the blue leaves of a tree with red veins, so it is with these monks.

source_sentence: 舉身支節一切毛孔血流如雨心大苦痛，哀愍安樂諸眾生故，欲發大乘方便密教故，
translation: It lifts up all the bodily limbs, pores, blood, and streams like rain. Their hearts are greatly pained, because they pity sentient beings and wish to bring them peace and happiness. They want to give rise to the esoteric teaching of the means of the Great Vehicle.

source_sentence: 教化因緣故，疾澡漱訖來詣佛所，稽首禮足繞百千匝，恭敬問訊於一面住。
translation: Due to the causes and conditions of his edification, he quickly went to the Buddha after bathing and rinsing, bowed his head at his feet, circumambulated him a hundred thousand times, respectfully saluted him, and remained off to one side.

source_sentence: 復有二十五億比丘尼，皆阿羅漢心得自在，所作已辦離諸煩惱，降伏諸根譬如大龍，
translation: There were also twenty-five million bhikṣus and nuns, all arhats whose minds were self-contained, free of afflictions as soon as they had done what they did, subduing their faculties like a great dragon.

source_sentence: 成就空慧逮得己利；
translation: They develop the wisdom of emptiness and attain their own benefit.

source_sentence: 其名曰：拘隣女須跋陀羅比丘尼，優婆難陀比丘尼，海智比丘尼等，如日初出照青樹葉赤脈悉現，
translation: Their names were Kauṇḍinya Subhadra Bhikṣuṇī, Upananda Bhikṣuṇī, Upānanda Bhikṣuṇī, and Sanghabhadra Bhikṣuṇī, just as when the sun first came out it shone like blue leaves on a green tree.

source_sentence: 此諸比丘尼亦復如是，舉身支節一切毛孔血流如雨心大苦痛，哀愍安樂諸眾生故，
translation: Similarly, these bhikṣus and nuns lifted up all their bodily limbs, pores, and blood flowed like rain. Their hearts were overcome with great sorrow because they grieved for the well-being of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 欲發大乘方便密教故，教化因緣故，來詣佛所稽首禮足繞百千匝，恭敬問訊於一面住。
translation: Because he wanted to give rise to the esoteric teaching of the great vehicle of skillful means and the causes and conditions for teaching, he came to the Buddha, bowed his head at his feet, circumambulated him a hundred thousand times, respectfully saluted him, and stood to one side.

source_sentence: 復有諸比丘尼，皆是菩薩人中雄猛得十地行，教化因緣故現為女身，遊四無量能現為佛種種變化。
translation: Furthermore, there are bhikṣus and nuns who are all bodhisattvas among men who are heroic in the ten stages of cultivation, manifesting themselves as women because of the causes and conditions of their instruction, traveling through the four immeasurables to show various transformations for the Buddha.

source_sentence: 復有一恒河沙菩薩摩訶薩，人中雄猛一切功德皆已具足，以方便身深樂大乘，
translation: There was also a bodhisattva mahāsattva as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges River, heroic among men and fully endowed with all virtues, who, by means of his body of skillful means, deeply delighted in the Great Vehicle.

source_sentence: 正向大乘飢虛大乘，貪求大乘渴仰大乘，善能隨順一切世間，未度者度未脫者脫，
translation: They correctly dedicate themselves to the Great Vehicle, hunger for the great vehicle, thirst for the great vehicle, and long for the great vehicle. They can skillfully adapt to all worlds; liberating those who are not liberated is liberation, liberating those who are not liberated.

source_sentence: 於無數劫修習淨戒度脫眾生，於無數劫修習淨戒安慰眾生，於無數劫修習淨戒興隆三寶，
translation: He cultivated pure morality for countless eons to liberate sentient beings, comforted sentient beings by cultivating pure morality for countless eons, and promoted the Three Treasures by cultivating pure morality for countless eons.

source_sentence: 於無數劫修習淨戒轉正法輪，於無數劫修習淨戒成大莊嚴，於無數劫修習淨戒行處堅固，
translation: In countless eons cultivating pure precepts, he turned the wheel of the right teaching; in countless eons cultivating pure precepts, he became greatly adorned; and in countless eons cultivating pure precepts, his practice became firm.

source_sentence: 如是等無量功德皆悉成就，等觀眾生如視一子；
translation: All of these immeasurable virtues were accomplished, equal to the number of sentient beings who looked upon one child.

source_sentence: 其名曰：海德菩薩，無盡智菩薩等，如日初出照青樹葉赤脈悉現，此諸菩薩亦復如是，
translation: Their names were Oceanic Virtue Bodhisattva, Inexhaustible Knowledge Bodhisattva, and so on. Just as the sun rises at the beginning of the day to illumine the blue leaves of the cyanide veins all appearing like this, so also did these enlightening beings:

source_sentence: 舉身支節一切毛孔血流如雨心大苦痛，愍念安樂諸眾生故，欲發大乘方便密教故，
translation: It lifts up all the bodily limbs, pores, blood, and streams like rain with great pain and suffering in their hearts, because they are compassionate and bring peace and comfort to sentient beings, wanting to give rise to the esoteric teaching of the great vehicle of skillful means.

source_sentence: 教化因緣故，來詣佛所稽首禮足繞百千匝，恭敬問訊於一面住。
translation: Because of the causes and conditions for their edification, they came to the Buddha, bowed their heads at his feet, circumambulated him a hundred thousand times, venerated him, and stayed off to one side.

source_sentence: 復有二恒河沙五戒優婆塞，深樂一切諸對治法，苦樂常無常，我非我空非空依無依，
translation: Again, there are five laymen devoted to precepts as numerous as the grains of sand in two Ganges Rivers who profoundly delight in all antidote dharmas: suffering and pleasure are permanent and impermanent; self is neither self, emptiness is neither emptiness nor voidness.

source_sentence: 眾生非眾生，恒非恒吉非吉，有為無為泥洹非泥洹，深樂如是對治之法，
translation: Sentient beings are not sentient beings, always neither good nor bad; conditioned and unconditioned nirvana is not nirvana. They deeply delight in the antidote such as this:

source_sentence: 欲聞妙義闡揚大法，於無數劫淨修梵行而無毀失，欲行大乘為人廣說，
translation: Those who want to hear the sublime doctrine and expound the great teaching, cultivating pure religious practice for countless eons without disparaging it, wanting to practice the Great Vehicle and teach it widely to others.

source_sentence: 修習淨戒欲學堅固大乘，欲學隨順世間，欲學度脫世間，欲學興隆三寶，
translation: Those who practice pure precepts want to learn the steadfast Great Vehicle, want to learn in accord with the world, want to learn to liberate the world, and want to learn to make the Three Treasures flourish.

source_sentence: 欲學轉法輪，欲學大莊嚴，如是無量功德具足，等觀眾生如視一子；
translation: Those who want to learn the turning of the wheel of the Teaching and those who want to learn great adornment are like this, endowed with immeasurable virtue, equal in number to all sentient beings as if they were looking at one child.

source_sentence: 其名曰：光無垢稱王優婆塞，善德優婆塞，如是等二恒河沙優婆塞，於晨朝時為供養如來故，
translation: Their names were Upāsaka King of Undefiled Renown in the Light, Upāsaka King of Glory, Upāsaka of Virtue, and so on. These two kinds of upāsaka, as numerous as the grains of sand in two Ganges Rivers, served the Buddha with offerings from morning until noon.

source_sentence: 人人各作五千栴檀床帳沈水床帳，眾寶床帳天香床帳，欝金香華床帳等，
translation: Each of them made five thousand sandalwood beds, sunken water beds, jeweled beds, heavenly fragrant beds, ornate gold beds, incense beds, and other such curtains.

source_sentence: 其諸床帳悉以牛頭栴檀香薰，莊嚴種種奇妙七寶，校飾金繩羅網以覆其上，
translation: The beds and curtains were all perfumed with the fragrance of ox-head sandalwood, adorned with various exquisite seven jewels, draped with golden cords and nets.

source_sentence: 青色青光、黃色黃光、赤色赤光、白色白光、紅色紅光、頗梨色頗梨光、如意珠色如意珠光，
translation: the blue-colored light of blue, the yellow-colored light of yellow, the red-colored light of red, the white-colored light of white, the red-colored light of pink, the crystal-colored crystal light, and the wish-granting pearl-colored wish-granting pearl light.

source_sentence: 以如是等雜色莊嚴，殊勝希有周匝障幔，皆以七寶羅網羅覆其上，周迴四面懸眾寶幡，
translation: Such adornments of various colors as these were extraordinary and rare, surrounded by obstructive curtains, all covered with nets of seven treasures, draped on the four sides with banners of myriad jewels.

source_sentence: 種種雜香以塗其上，金縷織成以為垂帶，其寶帳內種種異色莊嚴如上，
translation: It was covered with various perfumes and draped with golden thread woven to make a hanging belt. The jeweled curtains were of various colors and adorned as shown above.

source_sentence: 七寶織成以為茵蓐，柔軟香薰以敷其內。
translation: It was woven of the seven kinds of treasure to make a quilt and covered with soft, fragrant odor.

source_sentence: 一一床帳各載以寶車，其車嚴好七寶莊嚴，前後皆有寶幢幡蓋，一一幡蓋皆以七寶羅網，
translation: Each couch was draped with a jeweled chariot. Each chariot was beautifully decorated with the adornments of the seven kinds of treasure. Behind it were jeweled banners, pennants, and canopies, and each canopy was draped with a net of the seven kinds of treasure.

source_sentence: 青黃赤白七寶莊嚴，及四種華優鉢羅鉢曇摩拘牟頭分陀利，亦以七寶校飾如前，
translation: They were adorned with the seven treasures of blue, yellow, red, white, and white, and decorated with the four kinds of flowers, utpalapadma-kusumitābhijña, as before.

source_sentence: 結眾雜寶以為華鬘，鮮好白[疊*毛]圖畫如來本生之像，表現菩薩從初發意至于成佛，
translation: They gathered together various kinds of precious substances to make a flower garland, and painted exquisitely white cotton cloth with portraits depicting the Buddha’s past births. This represented the enlightening being’s progress from the first inspiration for enlightenment until his attainment of buddhahood.

source_sentence: 中間受身種種苦行無不記列。
translation: The various kinds of painful physical and ascetic practices that are experienced in the interim are listed without fail.

source_sentence: 俠道兩邊作眾伎樂，其諸樂器皆用七寶，其音和雅皆出無常苦空之音，
translation: On both sides of the heroic path they played various kinds of music, all made of the seven kinds of treasure. Their voices were harmonious and elegant, producing the sound of impermanence, suffering, and emptiness.

source_sentence: 咸言怪哉世間虛空，悲號泣淚聲振天地，為供養故各齎名華細末雜香，
translation: They all said, “How marvelous is the space of the world! The sound of weeping and wailing shook heaven and earth in distress.

source_sentence: 又辦種種上味之食，用山澗水然以香薪，令食細軟香味具足。
translation: He also prepares various kinds of delicious food, using mountain stream water and fragrant firewood to make the food have fine, mild flavors and full fragrance.

source_sentence: 又於堅固林內外掃灑布七寶沙，香薰寶衣以覆其上，周迴敷置三十二行師子之座，
translation: He also spread out seven-jeweled sand inside and outside the firm forest, covered it with fragrant jeweled robes, and arranged thirty-two rows of lion seats all around.

source_sentence: 皆以七寶莊嚴，雕文刻鏤五色晃曜，眾妙雜香用薰其座，七寶茵蓐以敷其上。
translation: They were all adorned with the seven kinds of treasure, carved and carved in five colors and shining brilliantly arrayed. The seats were perfumed with various exquisite fragrances and covered with seven-jeweled mattresses.

source_sentence: 眾事辦已而作是念：「一切眾生有所須欲我悉施與，衣服飲食財物珍寶國城妻子，
translation: Having accomplished all these things, he thought: I will give whatever sentient beings need anything they want to me.

source_sentence: 頭目髓腦血肉肌體，貧富貴賤隨其所須各令充足，唯除色欲毒藥及害生等不淨之施。」
translation: Their heads, eyes, marrow, bones, blood, flesh, flesh, and skin are each made abundant according to their needs, except for the unclean offerings of form, desire, poison, medicine, and harmful birth.

source_sentence: 是諸優婆塞發菩薩心而作是念：「我等持是床帳寶車眾物供具施佛及僧，
translation: These laymen and women, having undertaken the vow of enlightenment, thought: “We will give these beds, drapes, jewel chariots, and other things to the Buddha and the Sangha.

source_sentence: 是為最後供養大施。」
translation: This is the final offering of great merit.

source_sentence: 各作是念：「佛及大眾受我供已，今日如來當般泥洹。」
translation: Each thought, After the Buddha and the crowd had accepted my offerings, today the Tathāgata will enter parinirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 作是念已其心悲亂，譬如日出照青樹葉赤脈悉現。
translation: After he had this thought, his mind was in distress, like the sun rising to shine on a blue tree with leaves and red veins all appearing.

source_sentence: 諸優婆塞亦復如是，舉身毛孔血流如雨，身心毒痛悲泣流淚。
translation: Similarly, the laymen raised their pores and blood flowed like rain, and their bodies and minds were poisonous, painful, sorrowful, weeping, and shedding tears.

source_sentence: 又於堅固林側施大帳幔七寶莊校，高廣嚴好上際虛空，於其帳內立七寶舍，
translation: Also, beside the great canopy of seven-jeweled adornment at the side of the firm forest, he offered a large canopy as high and wide as the sky above. Within that canopy he set up a house made of seven-jeweled ornaments.

source_sentence: 饌具畢已，來詣佛所稽首佛足，幢蓋供養遍滿虛空，燒香散華猶如雲雨，
translation: Having prepared the food, they came to where the Buddha was. They bowed their heads at his feet and greeted him with offerings of banners and canopies all over the sky, burning incense and scattering flowers like clouds and rain.

source_sentence: 咸皆悲慕哀動天地，撫臆號叫淚下如雨，更相謂言：「怪哉仁者世間虛空，
translation: They all grieved and mourned in heaven and earth, weeping and wailing like rain. They said to each other, “How strange!

source_sentence: 一何駃哉世間眼滅。」
translation: One, what's the matter with the cessation of the worldly eye?

source_sentence: 頭面著地同聲請佛：「願佛及僧哀愍我等，與諸大眾俱受我請，受我請已當般泥洹，
translation: They bowed their heads and faces to the ground in unison and called out to the Buddha, “May the Buddha and the members of the sangha have compassion for us! Accept our invitation together with all the members of the sangha. Having accepted my invitation, they will enter final nirvana.

source_sentence: 令我等飯佛大眾得最後施福。」
translation: Let us rice buddhas and the masses attain the final merit of giving.

source_sentence: 世尊知時默然不受，如是三請佛亦默然。
translation: Knowing this, the Bhagavān remained silent and didn't accept it, and these three requests to the Buddha were also silenced.

source_sentence: 時諸優婆塞一切望絕愁憂苦惱，猶如慈父唯有一子，卒病命終送殯而還愁憂苦惱，
translation: It was just as if a loving father had only one child who died suddenly of illness and was buried in sorrow and suffering.

source_sentence: 諸優婆塞愁憂苦惱亦復如是，作禮而起於一面住。
translation: Similarly, the laymen were grieved and distressed, paid homage, and stood to one side.

source_sentence: 復有三恒河沙優婆夷，皆持五戒功德具足，現為女像化度眾生，呵責己身猶如四蛇，
translation: Again, there were female laymen as numerous as the grains of sand in three Ganges Rivers. All of them observed the five precepts and perfected themselves with virtuous deeds. They appeared to save sentient beings by means of women’s images. They reproached their bodies like four snakes.

source_sentence: 八萬戶蟲侵食其體，是身臭穢貪欲所惑，譬如死尸無一可樂，是身不淨九孔常漏，
translation: Eighty thousand household worms attacked their bodies, and this body smelled foul and defiled by craving. It was like a dead corpse that had no food to enjoy but its nine orifices were always leaking.

source_sentence: 血肉筋骨共相依假以為偽城，手足支節以為却敵，爪齒耳目以為寮孔，
translation: blood, flesh, tendons, and bones all relying on each other to make a fake city, their hands, feet, limbs, and joints to defeat enemies, and their nails, teeth, ears, and eyes to serve as living quarters.

source_sentence: 幻偽心法以為寮障，放逸調慢以為樓觀，惡賊意王居其城內，貪利蕩逸馳騁六境，
translation: The illusory mind and mental states of delusion are the refuges, heedlessness and self-conceit are the building blocks, bad thieves and kings live in their cities, and greed for profit and debauchery roam the six realms.

source_sentence: 如此賊城諸佛所棄愚夫所樂，貪欲瞋恚愚癡羅剎依止其中，如伊蘭叢林無可愛樂，
translation: In the same way thieving desire, hatred, folly, and delusion are like forests of elephant-ghost trees in which there is neither pleasure nor delight.

source_sentence: 聚沫芭蕉無有堅固，電光野馬呼聲之響，水月幻化如海濤波，駃流立草須臾不住，
translation: The mounds of foam and plantains are not strong, the sound of lightning and the sounds of wild horses screaming; the moon in water magically transforms like a wave on the ocean; the flowing streams and standing grass do not dwell for a moment.

source_sentence: 丘塚叢林穢惡充滿，狐狼鵰鷲烏鵄餓狗，諸惡虫輩競止其中，如此穢身安可堪處？
translation: The hills, mounds, jungles, and forests are filled with defilement, foxes, wolves, eagles, crows, hungry dogs, and bad insects that compete to stay in them. How can such a filthy body be sustained?

source_sentence: 若以一毛渧大海水尚可知數，此毒樹身四百四病，無量眾穢不可稱計，
translation: If you were to take a single hair and slice the great ocean water, which can still be counted, this poisonous tree would have four hundred and four illnesses on its body, with an immeasurable number of defilements that cannot be measured.

source_sentence: 如世尊說譬喻，天下草木斬以為籌，大地土石末為微塵，猶可知數。
translation: Just as the World-Honored One said in an analogy: The grass and trees of the earth are chopped up to make a chip, while the dust of dirt and stones of the earth is counted as tiny specks of dust.

source_sentence: 此身不淨無量雜惡，其數過是，是身暴害滅諸善法。
translation: This body is impure and immeasurable, mixed with countless bad qualities. The number of evil deeds it commits is excessive:

source_sentence: 是等優婆夷，能捨此身猶如棄唾，習行空行無相無作，深樂大乘常為人說。
translation: Such laymen and nuns can abandon their bodies like throwing away a spit, cultivating the practice of emptiness, formlessness, and noncontrivance, delighting in the great vehicle that's always taught for people.

source_sentence: 其名曰：耆婆尸利優婆夷，勝鬘優婆夷，毘舍佉優婆夷等，於晨朝時光明照已即覺斯瑞，
translation: They were called Upāsikā Jīvaka, Upāsikā Vaiśālī, Upāsikā Kauṇḍinya, Upāsikā Vaiśālī, and so forth.

source_sentence: 便各疾辦眾供養具倍勝於前，來詣佛所頭面著地，請佛及僧。
translation: Each of them then quickly prepared a multitude of offerings that were twice as great as the previous ones, came to the Buddha's place, touched their heads and faces to the ground, and invited him and the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 世尊不受。
translation: Bhagavān, you won't accept it.

source_sentence: 愁憂苦惱在一面住。
translation: He's grieved and distressed, and he's staying at one side.

source_sentence: 復有四恒河沙諸離車童子，在毘舍離城內并外來者，及閻浮提邊國諸王大臣，
translation: Again, there were Licchavi youths as numerous as the grains of sand in four Ganges Rivers. They came from Vaiśālī and stayed at Vaiśālī’s city together with those who had come from beyond Vaiśālī. As well as the officials of the various kingdoms on the peripheral fringe of Jambudvlpa.

source_sentence: 俱樂正法淳修戒行，眾德成就，伏諸異學及亂法者，普能惠施無畏之法，
translation: They delighted in the true teaching and cultivated purely moral practice; their virtues perfected, they subdued heretics and those who taught disorderly doctrines. They were able to give all kinds of favours to the fearless Dharma.

source_sentence: 為眾演說無盡法藏，悉能修習諸佛所說甘露妙法，摧伏眾魔外道邪論，
translation: They expound the inexhaustible treasury of truth for all. They are able to cultivate the sublime teaching of immortality preached by the Buddhas, and overcome the deluded theories of demons and heretics.

source_sentence: 自持律行令持戒僧得力安隱，自持律行樂聽大乘為人廣說，普慈愍傷一切眾生德皆如上。
translation: He himself observes the precepts and practices so that the observant monks attain power and peace, observes the precepts and practices with ease, listens to the great vehicle being explained in detail for others, universally compassionately pitying all sentient beings, and has the same virtues as the above.

source_sentence: 其名曰：淨離垢藏離車童子，常快淨離車童子，恒水離垢淨離車童子等，
translation: Their names were Pure, undefiled treasury, free from the chariot boys, always joyful, pure, free from the chariot boys, constant water, undefiled, pure, free from the chariot boys, and so forth.

source_sentence: 是諸離車各辦八十四億栴檀床帳，沈水床帳，欝金床帳，栢木床帳，兜樓香木床帳，
translation: Each of the Licchavi ministers arranged eighty-four hundred million canopies of sandalwood bed curtains, sunken water bed curtains, gold bed curtains, mahogany bed curtains, and Tuṣita wooden bed curtains.

source_sentence: 亦各八十四億雕文刻鏤，七寶莊嚴五色光耀嚴飾如前，各辦八萬四千寶馬，
translation: Each also had eighty-four hundred million carvings inscribed on it, adorned with the seven kinds of treasure and shining arrays of five colors as shown above. Each mounted eighty-four thousand jeweled horses.

source_sentence: 八萬四千大象王，八萬四千四馬寶車，悉以神珠明寶絞絡莊飾，端嚴姝妙行如疾風；
translation: The eighty-four thousand great elephant kings and the eighty-four thousand four-horse jeweled chariots were all adorned with divine pearls, draped with bright jewel ornaments.

source_sentence: 又辦八萬四千明月神珠晝夜常明，幢蓋幡華大寶帳幔，白疊圖像次第如前。
translation: He also prepared eighty-four thousand bright moon spirit beads that were always bright day and night, with banners, canopies, streamers, flowers, great jeweled curtains, white cloth, and images in order as before.

source_sentence: 其寶華蓋廣一由旬，彩畫細疊以為圖像三十二由旬，其幔高顯各百由旬，
translation: The jeweled-flower canopy was one yojana wide and thirty-two yojanas high, covered with exquisitely patterned cloth. Each curtain was a hundred yojanas high.

source_sentence: 其幡各長一千由旬，七寶莊校嚴飾如前；
translation: Each of the banners was one thousand yojanas in length, adorned as before with the seven kinds of treasure.

source_sentence: 其飯香氣薰一由旬。
translation: The fragrance of that rice permeated the air for one yojana.

source_sentence: 敷置床座於堅固林供具悉備，來詣佛所稽首請佛，頭面禮訖於一面住。
translation: He spread out a bed and seat in a firm forest, prepared with offerings, came to the Buddha, bowed his head at his feet, saluted him by bowing his forehead and face, and stood to one side.

source_sentence: 復有閻浮提內大長者五恒河沙，深樂正法淳修戒行眾德成就，伏諸異學及亂法者，
translation: Again, there were great householders in Jambudvfpa as numerous as the grains of sand in five Ganges Rivers who deeply delighted in the true-dharma and practiced morality purely. They perfected virtue and subdued heretics and followers of the confused doctrine.

source_sentence: 深樂大乘。
translation: They deeply delight in the great vehicle.

source_sentence: 其名日：月光王薝蔔華首長者，法首長者，如是等長者子及長者女五恒河沙，
translation: The name of the day was Candraprabha, the king of the moon-luminosity, the elder named Ambapālī, the elder named Dharmâkara, the elder named Mahāprajāpatī.

source_sentence: 於晨朝時承佛威神，辦眾供具倍復勝前，來詣佛所稽首請佛，頭面禮足於一面住。
translation: In the morning, he inherited the Buddha's authoritative power and prepared an array of offerings that were even greater than before. He came to the Buddha, bowed his head at his feet, saluted him by bowing his forehead to his feet, and stood to one side.

source_sentence: 復有毘舍離王內外眷屬，及閻浮提主大小城邑聚落野人君主，除阿闍世其餘諸王，
translation: Furthermore, there were the king Vaiśālī's inner and outer retinues, as well as the lords of Jambudvīpa, large and small cities, towns, villages, and wilderness rulers, with the exception of Ajātaśatru and other kings.

source_sentence: 月離垢藏王，日離垢王等六恒河沙，各將一百八十萬億眷屬，皆悉勇健力如龍象行如疾風，
translation: The moon king Undefiled Treasury, the sun king Undefiled, and so on, with a retinue equal in number to the sands of the six Ganges Rivers, each endowed with one hundred and eighty myriads of koṭis of retinues, all as strong and valiant as dragons and elephants, traveling like a gale.

source_sentence: 深樂正法淳修戒行，眾德成就伏諸異學及亂法者，所作供具轉倍勝前，
translation: He deeply delighted in the true teaching and simply cultivated morality, perfecting virtues to subdue heretics and those who taught disorderly doctrines. The offerings he made were even greater than before.

source_sentence: 來詣佛所稽首請佛，頭面禮足於一面住。
translation: They came to the Buddha, bowed their heads and feet, and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 復有閻浮提主大小諸王，夫人婇女七恒河沙，除阿闍世王，夫人婇女皆厭患女身，
translation: Again, there were rulers of Jambudvfpa, kings of both large and small countries, whose wives and concubines lived in palanquins as numerous as the grains of sand in seven Ganges Rivers. With the exception of King Ajātaśatru, all the wives and concubines disliked their women’s bodies.

source_sentence: 修行空行深樂大乘，廣為人說所修功德悉如前說，諸優婆夷其名曰：三界妙夫人，
translation: He cultivates the practice of emptiness and deeply delights in the Great Vehicle, extensively explaining to others the virtues he cultivates as explained above. The laymen there are called Wonderful Lady of the Three Worlds.

source_sentence: 念德夫人等，所作供具倍復勝前，於晨朝時來詣佛所稽首請佛，頭面禮足於一面住。
translation: Their offerings were even greater than the previous ones. In the morning they came to the Buddha, bowed their heads and feet at his feet, and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 復有八恒河沙諸天眾俱，普明天子等，皆樂大乘廣為人說，修行淨戒渴仰大乘，
translation: There were also eight other celestial beings as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges River, all like celestial beings who delighted in the Great Vehicle and taught it widely to others. They practiced pure morality and longed for the Great Vehicle.

source_sentence: 諸眾生類樂大乘者，以大乘法斷其渴仰，修行淨戒貪樂大乘，堅固大乘覺悟大乘，
translation: Those sentient beings who delight in the great vehicle abandon their craving for it by means of the teachings of the Great Vehicle. They practice pure morality and eagerly rejoice in the great vehicle; they are steadfast in the great vehicle and awaken to the enlightenment of the great vehicle.

source_sentence: 於大乘法不起嫉慢，伏諸異學及亂法者，護持正法修行淨戒，隨順世間，
translation: They do not give rise to jealousy or pride in the teachings of the Great Vehicle. They subdue heretics and those who teach distorted doctrines. They preserve the true Teaching, practice pure morality, and follow the ways of the world.

source_sentence: 未度者度未脫者脫，欲轉法輪欲興隆三寶永使不絕，欲建大莊嚴，如是等無量功德皆悉具足，
translation: Those who have not yet liberated themselves are liberated; those who want to turn the wheel of the Teaching and those who have not yet liberated themselves are liberated. They want to develop the three treasures, so that they never cease. They want to build great adornments. All these immeasurable virtues are fully endowed.

source_sentence: 等慈眾生猶如一子。
translation: Equanimous compassionate sentient beings are like a single child.

source_sentence: 是諸天等於晨朝時，光明照已覺斯瑞相，咸作是念：「如來不久當般泥洹。」
translation: When the gods and others awakened to this miraculous sign in the morning, they all thought, The Tathāgata will soon pass into nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 來詣佛所見眾供具各相謂言：「汝等觀彼人間供養，莊嚴殊特與天無異，
translation: They came to the Buddha and said to each other, “Look at the offerings of those who have come here. Their adornments are no different from those of the gods.

source_sentence: 供養如來為最後供，種種飯食供佛及僧最後大施，而今世尊悉皆不受。
translation: Making offerings to the Tathāgata is the final offering, and various kinds of rice and food are offered to the Buddha and the saṃgha as the final great gift, which the Bhagavān doesn't accept now.

source_sentence: 諸仁者，我等今日亦當為佛及僧并諸眷屬，為最後施成大施度，如來及僧并諸眷屬，
哀受我等最後供施當般泥洹，佛世難值最後施度倍復甚難。
translation: It's a pity that our final offering will be parinirvāṇa, but it's difficult for the Buddha to meet us in the world and save us with his final offering, which is even more difficult.

source_sentence: 怪哉仁者世間虛空，一何駃哉世間眼滅。」
translation: It's amazing, my dear friend, that the world is empty, and what's so sad about the cessation of the worldly eye?

source_sentence: 是諸天眾咸作是念：「我等亦當供養如來。」
translation: The gods all had this thought, We will also make offerings to the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 即辦供具倍勝人間，床帳車乘幢幡華蓋圖像帳幔，悉以天香天繒天寶莊嚴校飾。
translation: He then prepared an offering that was twice as great as those of the people, with a bed, curtain, chariot, carriage, banners, streamers, flowers, canopies, pictures, drapes, and curtains, all adorned with the adornments of heavenly fragrance, celestial silhouettering, and heavenly treasures.

source_sentence: 供具辦已，來詣佛所稽首禮足繞百千匝，恭敬問訊於一面住。
translation: Having prepared the offerings, they came to the Buddha, bowed their heads and feet, circumambulated him a hundred thousand times, respectfully greeted him, and remained off to one side.

source_sentence: 復有九恒河沙諸龍王從四方來；
translation: Again, there came from the four directions dragon kings as numerous as the grains of sand in nine Ganges Rivers.

source_sentence: 其名曰：和修吉龍王，難頭優鉢難陀龍王等，眾德具足哀愍世間，於晨朝時光明照已，
translation: Their names were Vātsīputrīya, Nāgārjuna, Upananda, Nanda, and so forth. Endowed with the virtues of universal compassion, they illumined the world in the morning and at dawn.

source_sentence: 各作是念：「如來不久當般泥洹。」
translation: Each thought, Soon, the Tathāgata will enter parinirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 辦眾供具倍勝人天，來詣佛所稽首請佛，繞百千匝於一面住。
translation: Their offerings were twice as great as those of humans and gods, and they came to the Buddha, bowed their heads in homage, circumambulated him a hundred thousand times, and stood to one side.

source_sentence: 復有十恒河沙諸鬼神王，毘沙門等一切鬼王，所作供養悉皆如前，來詣佛所稽首請佛，
translation: Again, there were the kings of spirits as numerous as the grains of sand in ten Ganges Rivers. Their offerings to Vaiśravaṇa and all the other kings of spirits were exactly as before. They came to the place where the Buddha was staying, bowed their heads at his feet, and begged him to take up his abode.

source_sentence: 繞百千匝於一面住。
translation: He circled it a hundred thousand times and stood to one side.

source_sentence: 復有二十恒河沙伽留羅王，龍怨伽留羅王等；
translation: There were also garuda kings as numerous as the grains of sand in twenty Ganges Rivers, such as nāgas and garuda kings.

source_sentence: 三十恒河沙揵闥婆王，那羅達揵闥婆王等；
translation: Thirty kings of the Ganges River, namely, the gandharva king Sthavira and the nādatta gandharva.

source_sentence: 四十恒河沙緊那羅王，快見緊那羅王等；
translation: The kinnara kings as numerous as the grains of sand in forty Ganges Rivers are to be seen.

source_sentence: 五十恒河沙摩睺羅伽王，大快見摩睺羅伽王等；
translation: The mahoraga king Sands of the Fifty Ganges Rivers, the mahoraga king Great Joyful Vision, and so on.

source_sentence: 六十恒河沙阿修羅王，遊空阿修羅王等；
translation: Sixty asura kings as numerous as the grains of sand in sixty Ganges Rivers, such as the asura king Traveling In Space.

source_sentence: 七十恒河沙陀那婆王，法水離垢勝王等；
translation: Seventy were the sands of the Ganges River, such as the king Dhānabhavyūha, the pure water of the Teaching, and so on.

source_sentence: 八十恒河沙羅剎王，廣怖畏羅剎王等；
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla kings as numerous as the grains of sand in eighty Ganges Rivers, equal in number to the great fearsome Rāṣṭrapāla kings.

source_sentence: 九十恒河沙叢林主王，樂香叢林主王等；
translation: The ninety kings of the Ganges River, such as the chief ruler of the sandy jungles and the chief ruler of the pleasant fragrant jungles.

source_sentence: 千恒河沙持呪王，大幻持呪王等；
translation: A thousand dhāraṇī kings as numerous as the sands of a thousand Ganges Rivers, including the great dhāraṇī king Great Illusory Dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 一億恒河沙欲色，眾善現欲色等；
translation: These are the forms of sexual passion as numerous as the grains of sand in one hundred million Ganges Rivers. All good deeds manifest such forms of sexual passion.

source_sentence: 百億恒河沙天女，眾藍婆天女等；
translation: Ten billion celestial maidens of the sands of the Ganges River, including all the other heavenly maidens named藍婆.

source_sentence: 千億恒河沙負多王，宿君坻負多王等；
translation: Hundreds of myriads of koṭis of sands of the Ganges River carry many kings, including the constellations ruler, throne, and so on.

source_sentence: 百千億恒河沙天子四天王等；
translation: Hundreds of thousands of myriads of koṭis of celestial beings equal in number to the sands of the Ganges River, including the four heavenly kings.

source_sentence: 百千億恒河沙風神王；
translation: Hundreds of thousands of myriadstical kings of wind spirits, as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges River.

source_sentence: 一億恒河沙樂雲雨神王；
translation: A hundred million celestial kings, like the clouds and rain showered by the sands of the Ganges River.

source_sentence: 一切世間寂靜雲雨王。
translation: All the worlds are tranquil, clouds and rain kings.

source_sentence: 是諸王等於晨朝時光明照已覺斯瑞相，各作是念：「如來不久當般泥洹。」
translation: In the morning, these kings and others perceived this miraculous sign when the light shone in the morning, and each thought, The Tathāgata will soon pass into nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 雨眾供具倍勝人天，來詣佛所稽首請佛，繞百千匝於一面住。
translation: They rained down offerings twice as numerous as those of humans and gods, came to the Buddha, bowed their heads in homage, circumambulated him a hundred thousand times, and stayed off to one side.

source_sentence: 復有二十恒河沙香象王，金色紺眼象王等，是諸象王隨其力能於雪山中取眾香藥草，
translation: There were also elephant kings as numerous as the grains of sand in twenty Ganges Rivers, such as the golden-colored and blue-eyed elephant kings. These elephant kings were able to gather all kinds of fragrant herbs and medicinal plants from the Himalayan mountains according to their power.

source_sentence: 及諸名華優鉢羅、鉢曇摩、拘牟頭、分陀利華等大如車輪，及山川水陸所生諸華，
translation: and the flowers called utpala, padma, kumuda, and puṇḍarīka are as large as a carriage wheel, as well as the flowers that grow from mountains, rivers, water, and land.

source_sentence: 以用莊嚴床帳供具，悲鳴號吼聲震天地：「一何駃哉世間虛空，一何駃哉世間眼滅。」
translation: Using the adorned bed coverings and offerings, he cried out in sorrow and shook heaven and earth with a roar, What's wrong with the worldly sky and what's wrong with the worldly eye ceasing?

source_sentence: 來詣佛所頭面禮足於一面住。
translation: They came to the Buddha, bowed their heads and feet, and stayed at one side.

source_sentence: 復有三恒河沙師子王，大震吼師子王等；
translation: There were also lion kings as numerous as the grains of sand in three Ganges Rivers, such as Great Shaking and Roaring Lion King.

source_sentence: 皆於眾生普施無畏，及諸鳥王迦蘭陀鳥，迦陵頻伽鳥王等，所作供養悉如象王。
translation: They all universally bestow fearlessness on sentient beings, and the bird kings, the kalaṇḍa birds, the kalaviṅka bird kings, and so forth make offerings like an elephant king.

source_sentence: 復有諸牛羊王，詣堅固林出好香乳，一切坑池乳皆流溢。
translation: Again, there were cow kings and sheep kings who went to the firm forest and produced good-smelling milk, and all the pits and pools overflowed with milk.

source_sentence: 復有諸蜜蜂王皆以香蜜盈滿其中，如是等比數如恒河沙，悉詣佛所頭面禮足於一面住。
translation: There were also honey bee kings, all filled with fragrant honey, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, who went to the Buddha's place, bowed their heads and feet, and stood to one side.

source_sentence: 復有萬恒河沙五通神仙，與四天下一切眾仙俱，忍辱仙人等，作種種神力，
translation: There were also five sages of supernatural powers as numerous as the grains of sand in ten thousand Ganges Rivers, accompanied by all the other sages of the four quarters of the earth.

source_sentence: 所作供養悉倍勝前，來詣佛所以髮布地，稽首佛足於一面住。
translation: The offerings they made were all twice as great as the previous ones, so they came to the Buddha and spread them out on the ground, bowed their heads at his feet, and stood to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時十六大國比丘比丘尼，唯除尊者大迦葉尊者、阿難二眾，餘者悉集滿一由旬悉皆如前。
translation: At the time, all the monks and nuns of the sixteen great countries except for Venerable Mahākāśyapa and Venerable Ānanda and the two groups of others who had gathered together for a full one yojana were as before.

source_sentence: 比丘比丘尼眾於晨朝時，來詣佛所稽首佛足，繞百千匝於一面住。
translation: At dawn, the monks and nuns of the assembly came to the Buddha's place in the morning, bowed their heads at his feet, circumambulated him one hundred thousand times, and stood to one side.

source_sentence: 復有萬恒河沙諸小山神王，大山神王，世界中間諸鬼神王，須彌山神王，
translation: There were also deities as kings of the smallest mountains as numerous as the grains of sand in ten thousand Ganges Rivers, those as kings of the great mountains, spirits as kings of the intermediate worlds, and mountain spirits as kings of the polar mountain.

source_sentence: 食諸樹葉華果種種生類，皆有神力放大光明，來詣佛所稽首禮足於一面住。
translation: Eating leaves, flowers, fruits, and various kinds of living beings, they all had miraculous powers to emanate great light and came to the Buddha, bowed their heads at his feet, and stood to one side.

translation: On top of the bathing pond there are various kinds of heavenly fragrant trees, and the water is as fragrant as sandalwood in all directions when blown by the wind.

translation: Each wall is sevenfold, all made of the seven kinds of treasure. Each also has a garden, an exposition, and a bathing pond. The five senses delight in pleasure and travel freely wherever they wish; there are no suitable hosts.

source_sentence: 其地柔軟散五色華薰以天香。
translation: The ground was soft and covered with five-colored flowers that perfumed heavenly fragrance.

translation: Furthermore, there are no śrāvakas or pratyekbuddhas named there. Rather, it is the single great vehicle of universal enlightenment. On each and every flower there is a great king standing on a jeweled seat like a lion’s throne, with legs supporting his feet.

source_sentence: 眾寶帳幔彌覆其上，以大乘法化度眾生。
translation: It's covered with a curtain of all kinds of treasures, and it uses the great vehicle teaching to save sentient beings.

translation: The sentient beings then had no desire or pleasure but grieved and cried in distress. They gradually marched on their way to the great city of Kuśinagara and said to each other, “Look at these extraordinary offerings made by gods and humans.

translation: The incoming bodhisattvas also prepare their offerings, and the various flavors of rice and food that are pure and fragrant can't be compared to them.

source_sentence: 大身菩薩與諸眷屬，從身毛孔出寶蓮華，所齎飯食供佛及僧，其飯香氣普薰三千大千世界，
translation: The great-bodied bodhisattva and his retinues produced jeweled lotus flowers from their pores from their bodies, carrying food for offerings to the Buddha and the Sangha. The fragrance of that food permeated the 3,000 great one-thousand worlds.

source_sentence: 眾生聞者一切煩惱皆悉除滅，蓮華寶帳幢幡華蓋，一切供具無可為喻，
translation: All the afflictions of sentient beings who hear it are completely extinguished, with lotus-flower jewel curtains, banners, streamers, and canopies, and all the offerings there are untold metaphors.

source_sentence: 從其本國來向此土，乘虛而至猶若高臺，一切眾生無不悉見。
translation: He came from his native land and headed for this land, flew up in space like a high terrace that all sentient beings could see.

source_sentence: 大身菩薩及諸眷屬設眾供養倍過諸天，唯除如來光明，梵釋諸天光蔽不現。
translation: The great body bodhisattva and his retinues offered offerings that were twice as great as those of the gods, except for the Tathāgata's light, which was obscured by the Brahma and Śakra gods' light.

source_sentence: 彼諸菩薩其身毛孔皆雨蓮華，其花香薰普遍三千大千世界，諸聞香者罪垢消除發菩提心。
translation: Those bodhisattvas all rained lotus flowers from their pores on their bodies, and the fragrance of those flowers pervaded 3,000 great one-thousand worlds, and those who heard the fragrance removed the stain of sinfulness and aroused the mind of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 大身菩薩身大無量遍滿虛空，自捨如來餘無能測，稽首奉獻飯食眾供於一面住。
translation: The great body of the bodhisattva's body is so large and immeasurable that it fills space, abandoning itself to the Tathāgata without anyone else who can fathom it, bowing his head in homage to offer food and offerings to the crowd at one side.

source_sentence: 南方世界諸來菩薩，其身毛孔出寶蓮華，如閻浮提從蓮華上起七寶城倍勝東方。
translation: The coming bodhisattvas of the southern world produce jeweled lotus flowers from their pores, like Jambudvfpa producing a seven-jeweled city from above the lotus flower that's twice as great as the east.

source_sentence: 西方世界諸來菩薩，毛孔蓮花如四天下，城等眾具轉倍勝前。
translation: The incoming bodhisattvas of the western world have hair pores and lotus flowers like the four continents, and their cities and other necessities are doubly greater than before.

source_sentence: 北方世界諸來菩薩，毛孔蓮華如小千世界，城郭浴池亦倍勝前。
translation: The incoming bodhisattvas of the northern world are like a small thousand worlds with hair pores and lotus flowers, and their castles and bathing ponds are even greater than the previous ones.

source_sentence: 乃至十方世界無量阿僧祇諸來菩薩，皆如大身菩薩身滿虛空，毛孔蓮花猶如三千大千世界，
translation: Countless incalculable numbers of enlightening beings came from the ten directions, all like great-bodied enlightening beings filling space with their bodies, hair pores and lotus blossoms like the vast manifold cosmos.

source_sentence: 雨種種花及眾供具，自捨如來其身光明悉蔽眾會，稽首奉獻於一面住。
translation: They rained various flowers and other offerings, relinquished the Tathāgata's light from their own bodies to cover the assembly, bowed their heads, offered them to one side, and stayed there.

source_sentence: 爾時堅固林側為大吉祥地，周迴敷座三十二行，其處狹小而諸菩薩身大無量，
translation: At that time the ground of great auspicious signs was beside the firm forest, surrounded by thirty-two lines of seats. The space was small but the bodhisattvas’ bodies were immeasurable in size.

source_sentence: 諸天世人皆悉雲集而不迫迮，有座如鍼鋒處者，有座如毛端處者，有座如豪鋩處者，
translation: The gods and humans all gathered together like clouds without crowding. Some of the seats were as small as the tip of a needle’s needle; some were as small as hairtip points; some were as large as the base of an eunuch’s robe.

source_sentence: 有座如微塵處者，隨身大小各得安立而不苦患，乃至十方微塵數世界六種大動，
translation: Some seats are like tiny specks of dust: they can be arranged without pain or discomfort, whether big or small, even as many as atoms in the ten directions, and move in six ways.

source_sentence: 神通變化現希有相，各各隨力設供如前。
translation: The miraculous transformations show rare forms, and each one makes offerings as before according to their strength.

source_sentence: 時閻浮提唯除尊者大迦葉眷屬、尊者阿難眷屬、阿闍世王眷屬，其餘眾生無不來會。
translation: In Jambudvīpa, except for the retinues of Venerable Mahākāśyapa, the retinues of Venerable Ānanda, and the retinues of King Ajātaśatru, there were no other sentient beings who didn't come to the assembly.

source_sentence: 爾時虺蛇毒螫諸惡蟲類，魔鬼羅剎雜呪蠱道，皆生慈心不相侵害如視一子，
translation: At the time, vipers, snakes, poisonous stings, bad insects, ghosts, demons, rāṣas, and various spells all became compassionate and didn't harm each other like looking at a child.

source_sentence: 唯除一闡提輩。
translation: It's except for the icchantika group.

source_sentence: 爾時佛威神故，此三千大千世界地皆柔軟，無有丘墟沙礫荊棘毒草，眾寶莊嚴猶如西方極樂國土，
translation: Because of the great spiritual power of the Buddha at that time, the soil of these 3,000 great one-thousand worlds was all soft and there were no hills, mounds, sand, gravel, thorns, or poisonous plants. The arrays of myriad jewels looked like the land of ultimate bliss in the western direction.

source_sentence: 時會天人阿修羅眾，盡見十方微塵數世界，其中所有悉在目前如觀鏡像。
translation: At the time, the assembly of gods, humans, and asuras all saw as many worlds in the ten directions as there are dust motes, and all of them were present in front of him like contemplating mirror images.

source_sentence: 爾時如來從其面門出種種光明耀殊特，諸來會者其身光明皆蔽不現，一切眾生稽首勸請，
translation: The Tathāgata then emerged from the pore of his face with various rays of light shining brilliantly, and all the assembled beings who had come to the assembly were blinded by the light emanating from their bodies. All sentient beings bowed in homage and begged him to do so.

source_sentence: 所應作已還從口入。
translation: After he does what should be done, he returns and enters it from his mouth.

source_sentence: 時諸天人阿修羅等，即大恐怖身毛皆竪，各相謂言：「如來光明遍照十方無量世界，
translation: The gods, humans, and asura demons all became greatly frightened. All their hair stood on end and said to each other, “The light of the Tathāgata illuminates infinitely many worlds in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 所應作已還從口入更無餘事，必是最後泥洹之相。
translation: After he does what should be done, he returns back into his mouth and enters it without remainder, which must be the final sign of nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 天人奉獻皆悉不受，何其怪哉，四功德牙一旦廢捨，聖慧日光從今永滅，
translation: All the offerings of gods and humans are not accepted. How strange it is that once the tooth relic of the four virtues has been discarded, the sunlight of holy wisdom will cease forever from now on.

source_sentence: 慈悲寶船於斯沈沒。
translation: The jeweled boat of compassion sinks here.

source_sentence: 嗚呼！
translation: Aah!

source_sentence: 痛哉！
translation: That's painful!
