translation: All sentient beings are hopeless.

source_sentence: 悲號啼哭血淚如雨，譬如大雲普雨世界，時諸大眾啼哭流淚，亦復如是。
translation: It's like a great cloud raining all over the world, and it's likewise when the masses weep and wail with tears of blood and tears.

source_sentence: 大般泥洹經長者純陀品第三
translation: Chapter Three of the Third Chapter of the Sutra of Mahāprajñāpāramitā: The Elder Cunda

source_sentence: 爾時會中有拘夷城長者名曰純陀，與五百長者子俱威儀庠序，觀察眾會皆已來集，
translation: At the time, there was an elder named Cunda, a resident of Kuśinagara in that assembly, who was accompanied by five hundred laymen. He observed the comportment of the assembled crowd and gathered them all together.

source_sentence: 更整衣服為佛作禮心懷憂慼，如日初出照青樹葉赤脈悉現；
translation: They dressed themselves properly and paid homage to the Buddha with sadness in their hearts, just as when the sun began to rise it shone like blue leaves on a green tree. Their red veins all appeared.

source_sentence: 時彼長者亦復如是，舉身血出淚下如雨，繞百千匝合掌白佛：「唯願世尊，
translation: The elder then did the same, raising his blood and shedding tears like rain, circled it a hundred thousand times, joined his palms, and said to the Buddha, Please, Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 與諸大眾哀受我等最後供養，當令我及一切眾生悉蒙解脫，譬如田家貧子仲春之節耕田下種仰悕天雨，
translation: The great assembly of monks and nuns, having pity for us by accepting these last offerings, will cause us and all sentient beings to attain liberation. It is as if we were to plow the fields in the middle of spring on behalf of our poor children who are farmers, planting seeds under the soil and moistening the sky with rain from heaven

source_sentence: 今我如是身口意患煩惱眾垢，始蒙少習厭離之想。
translation: Now, I'm thus afflicted by the many defilements of body, speech, and mind, and I've only begun to experience a little bit of the perception of disillusionment.

source_sentence: 唯願世尊，當惠法雨與諸大眾，哀受我請，枯旱之田得蒙慈澤。」
translation: Please, Bhagavān, give the rain of the Dharma to the masses and pity them for accepting my invitation, so that the dry and drought-stricken field will be graced with kindness.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊一切種智知一切時告淳陀言：「如來、應供、等正覺與諸大眾，
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān, knowing all kinds of cognition at all times, addressed Cunda, saying, The Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, Perfectly Enlightened One, and the great assembly

source_sentence: 當受汝請最後供養。」
translation: I'll accept your request for a final offering.

source_sentence: 時諸天人阿修羅，聞如來、應供、等正覺受長者純陀最後供養，一切大眾內懷歡喜，
translation: When the gods, humans, and asuras heard that the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Enlightened One had received the last offering from the householder Cunda, they all rejoiced inwardly.

source_sentence: 異口同聲歎未曾有：「善哉！
translation: That's unprecedented, with one voice and one voice praising it, saying, Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Excellent, good!

source_sentence: 純陀長者！
translation: Gṛhapati Cunda!

source_sentence: 德願滿足。
translation: Their virtues and vows are fulfilled.

source_sentence: 甚奇純陀！
translation: How wonderful, Cunda!

source_sentence: 生人道中難得之利汝今已得，如優曇鉢華世間希有，佛出於世難值於此，
translation: Good man, it is difficult to find any advantage in the path of living beings. But you have now found such a rare and wonderful opportunity like the udumbara flower! The Buddha has appeared in the world but it is hard to find anyone like this.

source_sentence: 信心難得聞法亦難，佛臨泥洹最後供養復難於彼。
translation: It's difficult to believe and difficult to hear the teaching, and it's also difficult for the Buddha to make final offerings when he approaches nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 又復純陀！
translation: Again, Cunda!

source_sentence: 譬如春月十五日夜，純淨圓滿無諸雲翳，一切眾生莫不瞻仰，汝亦如是。
translation: Just as on the night of the fifteenth day of the spring month it is pure and perfect, without clouds or moonlight. All living beings cannot help but look upon it with reverence—you too are like this.

source_sentence: 如來、應供、等正覺與諸大眾，受汝最後檀波羅蜜。
translation: The Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, Equanimous Enlightenment, and the masses will accept your final perfection of giving.

source_sentence: 善哉純陀！
translation: Excellent, Cunda!

source_sentence: 是故說汝如月盛滿，一切眾生無不瞻仰。
translation: That's why you're said to be like the full moon, and all sentient beings don't fail to look up to you.

source_sentence: 奇哉純陀！
translation: How wonderful, Cunda!

source_sentence: 為佛真子，雖生人道今皆謂汝為天中天，是故我等當稽首禮。」
translation: Because you are the true son of the Buddha, even though you've been born in the human path, we now all call you a god among gods; therefore, we will bow our heads in homage.

source_sentence: 「雖生人道中，　　天相悉具足。
translation: Even though they're born in the human path, their heavenly forms are fully endowed.

source_sentence: 我及一切眾，　　今當稽首請；
translation: We and all the other members of the sangha should now bow our heads in homage.

source_sentence: 今若哀許者，　　當宣微心願。
translation: Now, if you're sympathetic and approve, you should proclaim a humble vow.

source_sentence: 若欲度眾生，　　唯應速勸請；
translation: If you want to save sentient beings, You should only promptly urge them.

source_sentence: 今日天中天，　　人中調御士；
translation: Today we are among the gods in heaven, Among humans and palace officials.

source_sentence: 圓應神通眼，　　無量功德相。
translation: Perfectly endowed with the eye of supernormal powers, it has boundless virtues.

source_sentence: 為眾生哀請，　　捨涅槃方便；
translation: Being grieved for sentient beings, They abandon the means of nirvana.

source_sentence: 天中天住世，　　廣說甘露法；
translation: The gods of the heavenly realm live in the world, Explaining extensively the ambrosia of truth.

source_sentence: 久遠生死苦，　　從是獲安隱。」
translation: For a long time, they've suffered the pain of birth-and-death, and from this they'll attain peace.

source_sentence: 咸共舉聲，而讚頌曰：爾時純陀長者歡喜踊躍，猶如有人卒喪父母憂悲頓至，
translation: They all raised their voices together and praised him, saying: At that moment the householder Cunda was overjoyed and jumped for joy. Just as a man dies suddenly after losing his parents in sorrow,

source_sentence: 臨送墓所忽然還活，瞻奉悲喜倍增敬情；
translation: Suddenly he came back alive at the place where the tomb had been buried, and as soon as he approached it his feelings of pity and joy grew even more respectful.

source_sentence: 「快哉我今得大利，　　人中妙果悉已獲。
translation: “How wonderful it is that I have now attained such great rewards, Whose fruits are among the most marvelous among men.

source_sentence: 快哉我今得大利，　　永閉泥犁惡趣門。
translation: It's wonderful that I've now attained great reward, which permanently closes the door to the bad destinies of niraya.

source_sentence: 快哉我今得大利，　　生世得值無上果；
translation: How wonderful it is that I have now attained great reward, born in the world to attain the unsurpassed fruit!

source_sentence: 猶如沙中求妙寶，　　忽遇金剛大歡喜。
translation: It's like someone seeking marvelous treasures in the sand who suddenly meets a vajra and becomes overjoyed.

source_sentence: 快哉我今得善離，　　在在處處畜生惑；
translation: How wonderful it is that I have now attained freedom from the defilements of animals, wherever they are.

source_sentence: 快哉我今得大利，　　優曇鉢華堅固信。
translation: It's wonderful that I've now attained great reward, and the udumbara flower has a firm faith.

source_sentence: 快哉我今得善離，　　餓鬼慳貪飢渴苦；
translation: How wonderful it is that I am now well freed from the suffering of hungry ghosts, thirst, hunger, and thirst!

source_sentence: 快哉我今得大利，　　難得施度到彼岸。
translation: It's wonderful that I've now attained great reward, but it's difficult to cross over to the other shore with generosity.

source_sentence: 從今永閉諸惡趣，　　阿修羅王究竟離。
translation: From now on, they'll be permanently shut off from bad destinies, and the asura king will be ultimately freed.

source_sentence: 快哉我今得大利，　　如來出世甚難遇；
translation: How wonderful it is that I have now attained such great rewards! The appearance in the world of the Enlightened One is so rare to encounter.

source_sentence: 優曇鉢華今得值，　　亦如芥子投針鋒。
translation: The udumbara flower can now be found, Just like a mustard seed dropping to the tip of a needle.

source_sentence: 快哉我今得善離，　　四天大王計常想；
translation: How wonderful it is that I have now attained peaceful separation! The great kings of the four quarters of heaven think of me as eternal.

source_sentence: 快哉我今得大利，　　法王大寶今悉見；
translation: How wonderful it is that I have now attained such great rewards! The great jewel of the King of Truth has now all been seen.

source_sentence: 乃至欲天十生處，　　諦了分明不染著。
translation: Up to the ten abodes of birth in the heavens of desire, they truly understand and clearly aren't stained by attachment.

source_sentence: 快哉我今得大利，　　世雄難遇今奉覲；
translation: How wonderful it is that I have now attained such great rewards! It is hard for a worldly hero to meet me, but now I am honored and venerated.

source_sentence: 猶如芥子投針鋒，　　值佛甚難復過是；
translation: It’s like throwing a mustard seed into the tip of a needle: How difficult it is to meet an enlightened one.

source_sentence: 盡三界源二十五，　　針鋒為喻亦復然。
translation: Extinguishing the source of the three realms is twenty-five, and so is the metaphor of the needle's tip.

source_sentence: 快哉我今得大利，　　值遇如來願滿足；
translation: How wonderful it is that I have now attained great reward, met the Buddha, and fulfilled my vow.

source_sentence: 摧滅一切諸凶惡，　　無量癡冥無知賊。
translation: Destroying all bad and evil, They are boundless thieves of delusion and ignorance.

source_sentence: 快哉我今得大利，　　生值離垢蓮華尊；
translation: How wonderful it is that I have now attained great reward, Being born to meet the undefiled lotus-flower honored one.

source_sentence: 快哉我今永得離，　　彌淪濤波生死海。
translation: How wonderful it is that I've now been permanently freed, submerged in the ocean of birth-and-death waves.

source_sentence: 快哉生世值如來，　　如海盲龜遇浮木；
translation: It’s wonderful to be born in the world and meet a buddha, Like an ocean blind tortoise encountering floating trees.

source_sentence: 快哉我今永得離，　　生死大海盲龜惑。
translation: It's wonderful that I've now permanently parted with the delusion of the blind tortoise in the great ocean of birth and death.

source_sentence: 快哉我今得大利，　　世未曾有無倫匹；
translation: How wonderful it is that I have now attained such great rewards, Unparalleled in the world.

source_sentence: 天人哀請悉不受，　　難請之寶我今得。
translation: All the gods and humans grieved and didn't accept it, but now I've obtained the treasure that's difficult to ask for.

source_sentence: 快哉我今得大利，　　天人修羅所尊奉；
translation: How wonderful it is that I have now attained such great reward, honored by gods, humans, and asuras!

source_sentence: 快哉今得現法果，　　大仙受我最後請；
translation: How wonderful it is that you have now attained the fruit of the present life! The great holy one accepted my last invitation.

source_sentence: 快哉我今得大利，　　與諸天人俱勸請。
translation: It's wonderful that I've now attained great reward, and I'm encouraged by both gods and humans.

source_sentence: 捨彼天人上妙饌，　　哀愍受我麁澁供；
translation: They give up the best food of gods and humans And take pity on us, accepting our humble offerings.

source_sentence: 快哉我今得大利，　　天人獻供願不果。
translation: It's wonderful that I've now attained great reward, but the gods and humans who offer offerings won't fulfill their vow.

source_sentence: 我供麁澁如伊蘭，　　如來大慈哀愍受；
translation: World-Honored One, my offerings are like mirages, Accepted with great compassion by the enlightened.

source_sentence: 諸天人民阿修羅，　　愁憂號泣稽首請。
translation: The gods, people, and asura demons Were grieved and cried in distress, bowed their heads to the ground, and begged for mercy.

source_sentence: 如來大悲普慈愍，　　等視眾生如一子；
translation: The great compassion of the enlightened is universal compassion, Equally looking upon all sentient beings as one child.

source_sentence: 假令不受眾飯供，　　願哀天人不滅度。
translation: Suppose someone doesn't accept the food offerings of the multitude, wishing to pity gods and humans who won't be liberated.

source_sentence: 彼諸天人無餘求，　　唯願如來永住世；
translation: Those gods and humans have no other request: They only wish the Enlightened One to abide forever in the world.

source_sentence: 猶如須彌處大海，　　跱金剛輪安不動。
translation: It's like Mount Sumeru in the ocean, whose diamond wheel is stable and unmoving.

source_sentence: 山水映發端嚴好，　　如來如是處大會；
translation: Mountains and rivers reflect the arrays of the Buddha’s features; The enlightened one is in such a great assembly.

source_sentence: 法王威光曜四眾，　　猶如重雲舉世闇，
translation: The majestic light of the King of Truth illumines the fourfold assembly, Like heavy clouds raising the darkness of the world.

source_sentence: 日光顯出除眾冥。　　今諸天人亦如是，
translation: The light of the sun appears and removes all darkness, just as gods and humans do now.

source_sentence: 久遠憂悲癡冥闇；　　唯願如來久住世，
translation: For a long time I have been in the darkness of sorrow, lamentation, and delusion.

source_sentence: 聖慧日光悉除滅。　　願長住世大智尊，
translation: May the light of the sun of holy wisdom be completely extinguished.

source_sentence: 願長住世大雄士；　　令我等心離憂怖，
translation: May you, great hero of the world, abide forever, freeing us from sorrow and fear.

source_sentence: 純陀長者及諸眷屬，歡喜踊躍亦復如是，五體投地叉手合掌，以偈頌曰：　猶若須彌安不動。」
translation: Similarly, the elder Cunda and his retinues rejoiced and jumped up and down, bowed their five bodies to the ground, joined their palms, and said in verse, It's like when Mount Sumeru is peaceful and unmoving.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告純陀曰：「如是，純陀！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Cunda, So it is, Cunda!

source_sentence: 佛興於世甚難得值，猶如海沙一金剛粟；
translation: It is difficult to find a buddha in the world, like an adamantine grain of sand in the ocean.

source_sentence: 人身難得又復過是，具足信心亦復甚難，猶如盲龜值浮木孔，得遇如來臨般泥洹，
translation: It is as if a blind tortoise were to find a hole in a floating piece of wood and encountered the Tathāgata, who was about to enter final nirvana.

source_sentence: 最後所供檀波羅蜜復難於彼，如優曇鉢華時一現耳。
translation: The final offering of the perfection of giving is again difficult for them, like the once-presenting flower of the udumbara flower.

source_sentence: 汝今純陀，莫生憂惱應大歡喜。
translation: Now, Cunda, don't become sad and distressed, and you should be overjoyed.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 當作是念：『今日如來與諸大眾受我最後大施供養，以是善利故應歡喜。』
translation: You should think, 'Today, the Tathāgata and the masses will accept my last great offering of support as an offering to them, and because of this good benefit, they should rejoice.'

source_sentence: 汝今純陀，勿請如來長住此世，當觀世間皆悉無常，一切眾行性亦如是。」
translation: Now, Cunda, don't invite the Tathāgata to stay here for a long time; observe that the world is completely impermanent, and so are all the natures of all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 「正使久在世，　　終歸會當滅；
translation: The true envoy has been in the world for a long time, And when he returns at the end of his existence, He will surely perish.

source_sentence: 雖生長壽天，　　命亦要之盡。
translation: Even though they grow in the long-lived gods, their life also requires them to die.

source_sentence: 事成皆當敗，　　有者悉磨滅；
translation: All things that are formed will be destroyed, and all that exists will be annihilated.

source_sentence: 壯為老所壞，　　強者病所困。
translation: The strong are destroyed by old age, and the strong are tormented by illness.

source_sentence: 人生皆有死，　　無常安可久；
translation: All living beings are subject to death, which is impermanent and peaceful for a long time.

source_sentence: 無色無強力，　　亦無有壽命。
translation: The formless one has no power, Nor any life span.

source_sentence: 妻子及象馬，　　錢財悉復然；
translation: Their wives, elephants, horses, and riches were all the same.

source_sentence: 世間諸親戚，　　眷屬皆別離。
translation: The worldly relatives and dependents are all separated from each other.

source_sentence: 三界大恐怖，　　乃至惡道苦；
translation: The great fear of the three realms, Up to the suffering of woeful states.

source_sentence: 斯等悉歸滅，　　安可不厭患？
translation: They all return to cessation, so how can they not become disillusioned?

source_sentence: 有有生老相，　　所謂慚恥法；
translation: The so-called method of shame has the characteristic of birth and old age.

source_sentence: 計常所侵欺，　　而謂為長存。
translation: They think it's always deceived and cheated, Yet they call it long life.

source_sentence: 清涼殊勝法，　　遠離於恐怖；
translation: The supreme teaching of purity and coolness Is far removed from fear.

source_sentence: 亦得離生老，　　病死之大患。
translation: They'll also be freed from birth and old age, the great danger of illness and death.

source_sentence: 亂心愚癡垢，　　此等謂皆度；
translation: Disturbed minds and the stain of ignorance: These are all liberations.

source_sentence: 無量無有餘，　　妙勝之寂滅。
translation: They are immeasurable, without remainder, The tranquility of the subtle and supreme.

source_sentence: 其義實無常，　　亦非蔭護法；
translation: Their meaning is really impermanent, And it does not shade the Dharma.

source_sentence: 但是眾苦聚，　　虛偽非堅固。
translation: It's just a mass of suffering that's false and not resolute.

source_sentence: 無堪無所忍，　　亦非可常保；
translation: Nothing can be tolerated, nothing is tolerated, Nor can it always be preserved.

source_sentence: 斯等如蠶虫，　　結網而自纏。
translation: They're like silkworms that bind themselves in a net.

source_sentence: 輪迴三界中，　　無一可樂處；
translation: In the three realms of transmigration, There is not a single delightful state.

source_sentence: 唯有生老苦，　　病死之大患。
translation: Only the suffering of birth and old age Is the great danger of sickness and death.

source_sentence: 知義者能見，　　壽命日夜流；
translation: Those who know the meaning can see Their lifespan, which flows day and night.

source_sentence: 衰減欺誑法，　　恐怖無暫歡。
translation: Weakened by the law of deceitfulness, they're frightened and don't rejoice for a moment.

source_sentence: 疾病憂悲惱，　　諸非義盈滿；
translation: Sickness, sorrow, pity, and vexation, Filled with non-real meanings.

source_sentence: 欲火輪熾然，　　眾難競來集。
translation: The wheel of the fire of desire is blazing, and it's difficult to gather people who are competing.

source_sentence: 智者永不住，　　受斯大苦痛；
translation: The wise one does not abide forever, enduring this great pain and suffering.

source_sentence: 曉了五欲患，　　是非功德利。
translation: Understanding the five afflictions of desire, he's benefited by right and wrong virtue.

source_sentence: 離欲無所貪，　　明了見真實，
translation: Being free of desire and not attached to anything, They clearly see reality.

source_sentence: 是為解脫觀，　　捨除諸生者；
translation: This is the contemplation of liberation, Rejecting all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 呵責害結怨，　　究竟棄諸有。
translation: Rebuking harmful bonds and enemies, they ultimately abandon existence.

source_sentence: 從此疾離一切數，　　猶如薪盡盛火滅；
translation: Being free of all kinds of illnesses, it’s like the burning out of a flame when its fuel is exhausted.

source_sentence: 妙色湛然常安隱，　　不為衰老所滅磨。
translation: Their subtle form is tranquil and always peaceful, not subject to decay by old age.

source_sentence: 無量疾苦不逼迫，　　壽命長存無終極；
translation: Countless illnesses and pains are not oppressed, Their lifespans last forever without end or end.

source_sentence: 無邊苦海悉已度，　　不隨時節劫數遷。
translation: The boundless sea of suffering has all been crossed, Yet it doesn’t change seasonally or yearly.

source_sentence: 快哉如來超三界，　　生死輪迴不復惑；
translation: How wonderful it is that the Buddha has transcended the three realms, Revolving in birth and death without confusion.

source_sentence: 汝莫觀我永滅度，　　猶如須彌跱大海。
translation: Don't observe that I'll be permanently liberated, just like Sumeru in the great ocean.

source_sentence: 純陀我今當泥洹，　　平等正法永安樂；
translation: Cunda, now I shall enter nirvana, Equal to the true teaching and eternally peaceful.

source_sentence: 諸明智者聞斯義，　　諦了分明不憂慼。
translation: The wise and knowledgeable hear this meaning, And clearly understand it without sorrow.

source_sentence: 莫以生死危脆身，　　微淺智慧測量佛；
translation: Don’t use the fragile body of birth and death to survey buddhas with shallow wisdom.

source_sentence: 我身真實處安隱，　　唯是天尊能諦了。」
translation: The true place of my body is peaceful, but only the Bhagavān can comprehend it.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊即為純陀而說偈言：爾時純陀白佛言：「善哉！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke a verse for Cunda, saying, At that point, Cunda said to the Buddha, Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Excellent, good!

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等凡劣得知如來泥洹不可思議，世尊！
translation: World-Honored One, we worldlings know that the nirvana of the Tathagata is inconceivable.

source_sentence: 我今便得與彼大人諸菩薩眾及諸羅漢等無有異，如文殊師利童子及阿羅漢，
translation: Now I am no different from those great bodhisattvas and arhats, just like the crown prince Mañjuśrī and the arhat Candracchattra.

source_sentence: 此等眾中若有最初受戒，即受戒曰得在僧數；
translation: Among these assemblies, if there is anyone among them who receives the precepts for the first time, receiving the precepts is said to be accompanied by being counted among the samgha.

source_sentence: 我今凡劣亦復如是，蒙佛威神得同斯等大賢眾數。
translation: Now, I'm just like this among ordinary and inferior people who have received the Buddha's authoritative power to attain the same number of great sages as these.

source_sentence: 唯然世尊！
translation: Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 願使如來長存於世，不願泥洹如燋敗種。」
translation: May the Tathāgata long remain in the world, not wishing for nirvāṇa to be like a rotten seed.

source_sentence: 文殊師利語純陀言：「莫作是願。
translation: Mañjuśrī said to Cunda, Don't make this vow.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 當作是觀，有為行法性自如是，如是觀者空慧具足，欲求正法當作是覺。」
translation: You should observe it this way, and the Dharma nature of conditioned phenomena is self-as such; thus observing it, you'll be endowed with the wisdom of emptiness and want to pursue the right teaching as an awakening.

source_sentence: 純陀答曰：「文殊師利！
translation: Cunda answered, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 夫如來者是人中尊為天中天，名為應供，豈是行耶？
translation: The Tathāgata is the honored among men and the god among gods, which is called worthy of offerings. Is this practice?

source_sentence: 若是行者為生滅法，譬如水泡速起速滅，往來流轉猶如車輪；
translation: The practitioner of this doctrine is concerned with the law of arising and ceasing. It is analogous to a bubble of water that quickly rises and disappears, going and coming in and out like a chariot wheel.

source_sentence: 若使如來是行數者，終不得出人天之上，非天中天亦非應供。
translation: If the Tathāgata were to make this number of practices, he wouldn't be allowed to go beyond humans and gods, which are not gods or goddesses in heaven or worthy of offerings.

source_sentence: 「復次，文殊師利！
translation: Furthermore, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 汝豈不聞有天長壽，而今如來不滿百歲，云何生死之法，稱人天上為天中天名曰應供？
translation: Didn't you hear that there are gods with long life spans, but now the Tathāgata isn't a hundred years old, so why is the teaching of birth-and-death called humans and gods in heaven and gods in heaven named worthy of offerings?

source_sentence: 文殊師利！
translation: Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 譬如有人作聚落主，隨其功勳漸漸遷轉得為高位，眾人所敬財力自在，
translation: Suppose there is a man who becomes a village chieftain and gradually advances to a high position in accordance with his virtue. The people revere him because he has control over their wealth and power.

source_sentence: 受福既盡還為貧賤人不齒錄；
translation: When the blessedness of enlightenment is exhausted, he returns as a poor man who does not record his teeth.

source_sentence: 若使如來是行數者，亦復如是，非人中上非天中天，亦非應供，轉為下劣。
translation: If the Tathāgata is counted as a practitioner, it's likewise, not among humans, not among gods, not among goddesses, and not worthy of offerings, which will become inferior.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 起滅法故。
translation: It's because of the arising and ceasing dharmas.

source_sentence: 是故文殊師利！
translation: Therefore, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 莫作是觀如來、應供、等正覺是行數也。
translation: Don't make this observation that the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Awakened One are the number of practices.

source_sentence: 「復次，文殊師利！
translation: Furthermore, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 為知而說？
translation: Explained for the sake of knowing?

source_sentence: 為不知而說？
translation: Why is it spoken of without knowing?

source_sentence: 如何妄想而謂如來是行數耶？
translation: How could it be a deluded conception that the Tathāgata is a number of practices?

source_sentence: 若如來是行數者，不名三界自在法王。
translation: If the Tathāgata is a practitioner, he won't be called the self-contained Dharma king of the three realms.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 譬如有王勇猛多力一人當千，時人號名千力士王，以能降伏千力士故；
translation: It is like the case of a king whose courageous and mighty army can be counted as one man or a thousand men. At that time people called him King of One Thousand Wardens because he was able to defeat a thousand wardens.

source_sentence: 如來、應供、等正覺亦復如是，降伏煩惱魔、陰魔、死魔、自在天魔，
translation: The Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Awakened One are likewise: they subdue the Māra of the defilements, the Māra of the aggregates, the Māra of death, and the Māra of the self-dependent gods.

source_sentence: 如是諸魔力士憍慢悉伏，是故如來、應供、等正覺得為三界自在法王，
translation: Thus, the Tathāgata, Arhat, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Enlightened One are the unimpeded Dharma kings of the three realms.

source_sentence: 若使如來是死法者，無實功德如千力士王也。
translation: If the Tathāgata is the Dharma of death, there's no real merit like the king of a thousand strong men.

source_sentence: 是故，文殊師利！
translation: Therefore, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 汝莫於如來起行數妄想。
translation: Don't give rise to the number of practices and deluded thoughts about the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 「復次，文殊師利！
translation: Furthermore, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 譬如巨富長者唯生一子，相師占子有短壽相，父母聞之心大愁慼，我等薄相居門不吉，
translation: Good man, this is analogous to the case of a wealthy man who has only one child. The soothsayer’s son will have a short life span but when his parents hear about him they will be greatly distressed.

source_sentence: 生短壽子不復愛重。
translation: He gave birth to a short-lived child who no longer loved him.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 夫天人婆羅門中有短壽者，斯等同輩自不愛敬以短壽故。
translation: If there are gods and humans among the brāhmaṇas who have short life spans, it's because they don't love or venerate themselves in their same group because they have short life spans.

source_sentence: 如是，文殊師利！
translation: So it is, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 若當如來同世人壽者，亦如世人不為父母之所愛敬，如來、應供、等正覺是行數者，
translation: If the Tathāgata were to live as long as everyone in the world, it would be just as if everyone in the world didn't love and respect him from their parents. The Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Awakened One are the number of practices.

source_sentence: 亦復不為人天阿修羅之所愛敬，現見轉變故。
translation: Nor will they be loved and respected by humans, gods, or asuras, because they'll see their transformation in the present.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 同一切法退敗知見，而為眾生說解脫教，如是義者何名正覺？
translation: They are the same as all dharmas that regress from knowledge and views and teach liberation to sentient beings, so what's the meaning of right awakening when it's like this?

source_sentence: 是故，文殊師利！
translation: Therefore, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 莫於如來起行數妄想也。
translation: Don't give rise to the number of practices and deluded thoughts about the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 「復次，文殊師利！
translation: Furthermore, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 如貧女人無有居止加復疾病，遊行乞匃止他客舍寄生一子，其客舍主驅遣令出，
translation: Suppose a poor woman who has no dwelling place and is further ill, travels around begging to stop another guest's house and sends birth to a child. The guest's owner drives the guest's house owner away and causes him to leave.

source_sentence: 抱兒隨道向豐樂國，於路困乏蚊虻毒虫唼食其身，經由恒水抱子而渡，
translation: Embracing the child, they proceeded along the highway to the kingdom of Fengle and passed through the Ganges River carrying the child in their arms.

source_sentence: 水流漂急不放其子，遂至沒溺母子俱死。
translation: The water flowed quickly and they didn't let their child go, so they went down and drowned the mother and child.

source_sentence: 由是慈心救子功德，身壞命終生淨妙天。
translation: Because of this virtue of the compassionate mind saving their children, they'll be born in the Pure and Wonderful Heaven when their body breaks up and their life ends.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 以不惜命救護子故。
translation: It's because they won't spare their lives to save and protect their children.

source_sentence: 文殊師利！
translation: Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 菩薩如是欲護正法者，不於如來而造行觀，造行觀者當知是人盲無慧眼，
translation: The bodhisattva thus wishes to protect the true-dharma, but he doesn’t contemplate on the Tathāgata. Those who contemplate should be aware that such people are blind and lack the eye of wisdom.

source_sentence: 於世尊所應正觀察不可思議，當知如來非有為法，以是現化安樂眾生，
translation: “World-honored One, the inconceivable is precisely what the World-honored One should contemplate. You should know that the Tathāgata is not a conditioned dharma; because of this he brings happiness and peace to sentient beings through his teaching.

source_sentence: 彼貧女人救護其子，不惜身命故生淨妙天；
translation: The poor woman rescued and protected her child. Because she did not spare her life, she was reborn in the Pure and Wonderful Heaven.

source_sentence: 護法菩薩亦復如是，能知如來非有為法，是長存法是久住法，因此護法得現法果速成解脫。
translation: So it is with the bodhisattva Dharma protector who can know that the Tathāgata isn't a conditioned dharma, which is a long-abiding dharma and a long-abiding dharma; thus, Dharma protector attains liberation quickly from the fruit of the present life because of this Dharma protector.

source_sentence: 「復次，文殊師利！
translation: Furthermore, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 譬如丈夫遠行寄止他舍疲極而臥，大火卒起焚燒此家，驚覺見火燒逼其身欲出火難，
translation: Suppose a man travels far away from home and stays in another house. He is exhausted and lying there. A great fire suddenly starts and burns the house into flames.

source_sentence: 衣服燒盡自愧裸身，不出火宅遂至燒死。
translation: His clothes burned out and he felt ashamed of himself, leaving his naked body. He did not leave the burning house but ended up being burned to death.

source_sentence: 以慚愧功德故，身壞命終，八十千返為三十三天王，復百千返為梵天王，
translation: Because of his virtue of shame and scruples he was reborn as the king of the thirty-three gods when his body dissolved and his life came to an end. He returned eighty thousand times to become the king of the Brahmā world, and again one hundred thousand times to become the king of the Brahma heavens.

source_sentence: 來生人中常為轉輪聖王，不墮惡趣永處安樂，因慚愧故如是。
translation: When they are born among humans, they'll always be a wheel-turning sage king who doesn't fall into bad destinies and always stays in peace, which is so because of their shame.

source_sentence: 文殊師利！
translation: Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 當知如來是方便行，應如彼丈夫慚愧而死，寧同外道翫習邪見，不為持戒比丘於無為如來作有為想知而妄語。
translation: You should know that the Tathāgata is a practitioner of skillful means who should die in shame like that man's husband, rather than following the mistaken views of non-Buddhists and not speaking falsely for the sake of observing precepts as a monk who gives rise to conditioned thoughts and knowing about the unconditioned Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 若於如來作有為想者，當知是人阿鼻地獄常為室宅；
translation: If someone conceptualizes the Buddha as having conditioned phenomena, they should be known to be a human being whose abode is always in the avīci hell.

source_sentence: 是故莫於如來作有為數，能於如來作無為想者，從是得度智慧大海，不為死尸之所迷惑，
translation: Therefore, do not think of the Tathāgata as a created entity. Those who think of the Tathāgata as an uncreated entity will thereby be liberated from the great ocean of knowledge and wisdom, so that they won’t be confused by dead corpses.

source_sentence: 是為甚深智度成就，以此智果疾逮如來具足相好。」
translation: This is the accomplishment of profound knowledge and liberation, which quickly acquires the Tathāgata's full physical appearance as a result of this knowledge.

source_sentence: 爾時文殊師利謂純陀言：「善哉！
translation: It was then that Mañjuśrī said to Cunda, Good!

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 應如是知，如來常住無為非變易法。
translation: You should thus know that the Tathāgata always abides in the unconditioned and doesn't change things.

source_sentence: 汝善男子！
translation: You, good man!

source_sentence: 有是智者亦能如佛隱覆有為方便示現，汝今不久當成佛道，如此勝妙奇特功德，
translation: Those who are endowed with such knowledge will also be able to follow the Buddha’s way of revealing their hidden, conditioned means of attaining buddhahood. Soon you will soon attain buddhahood.

source_sentence: 唯佛世尊乃能歎說。
translation: Only the Bhagavān can praise it.

source_sentence: 復次，純陀！
translation: Furthermore, Cunda!

source_sentence: 應時施及法施，出於一切眾施之上。
translation: Giving at the right time and giving according to the teachings are above all other forms of giving.

source_sentence: 應時施者，若比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷，若遠行來若在道路，隨其力能疾應所須，
translation: Giving at the right time means that if a monk, a bhikṣu, a bhikṣuṇī, an upāsaka, or a layman come from a distance or are on the road, according to their powers and abilities, they can quickly give whatever is needed.

source_sentence: 是檀波羅蜜種子生大果報。
translation: This is the great reward that arises from the seeds of the perfection of giving.

source_sentence: 純陀！
translation: Cunda!

source_sentence: 汝今隨其力能為佛及僧施最後供，宜知是時，世尊滅度垂至。」
translation: Now, according to their strength, you can make the final offering for the Buddha and the saṃgha, so it's advisable to know when the Bhagavān's nirvāṇa arrives.

source_sentence: 純陀答曰：「文殊師利！
translation: Cunda answered, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 何煩催此垢穢食為？
translation: What's the trouble that causes this defiled food?

source_sentence: 如來寧當待此食耶？
translation: How could the Tathāgata await this food?

source_sentence: 如來六年在道樹下難行苦行，日食麻米猶自支持，況今須臾豈不能耶？
translation: For six years the Tathāgata had practiced austerities under the [Buddhist] tree of enlightenment, but he still supported himself with rice and sesame every day. How could he not do so even for a short time?

source_sentence: 汝謂如來食此食乎？
translation: Do you say that the Tathāgata eats this food?

source_sentence: 如來法身非穢食身。」
translation: The Tathāgata's Dharma body is not a body of defiled food.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告文殊師利：「純陀所說，真實說也。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Mañjuśrī, What Cunda teaches is really what he teaches.

source_sentence: 又語純陀：「汝成大智，明解大乘。」
translation: Again, he said to Cunda, You've accomplished great wisdom and clearly understood the great vehicle.

source_sentence: 文殊師利謂純陀言：「汝今便為稱可如來為佛所念。」
translation: Mañjuśrī said to Cunda, Now, you're saying that the Tathāgata is praised and thought of by the Buddha.

source_sentence: 純陀答言：「如來豈偏念耶？
translation: Cunda answered, Does the Tathāgata have partial thoughts?

source_sentence: 一切眾生悉平等念。
translation: All sentient beings are all equally mindful.

source_sentence: 汝莫作此顛倒想說，念可念者是二悉無，當作是行。
translation: Don't make this mistaken notion that what's mindful and what's mindful are both completely nonexistent, and you should do so.

source_sentence: 夫愛念者，譬如乳牛雖復飢渴行求水草，若足未足忽念其子便疾還歸；
translation: Good man, it is analogous to a milk cow going hungry and thirsty in search of water or grass. If she has neither legs nor feet, then suddenly thinking of her child, she quickly returns home.

source_sentence: 諸佛世尊無此苦念，視一切眾生皆如一子，是智慧念諸佛境界。
translation: The buddhas and world-honored ones don't have this painful thought, but they look upon all sentient beings as one child, which is the sphere of wisdom and mindfulness of the buddhas.

source_sentence: 又，文殊師利！
translation: Also, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 譬如象馬寶車遲速不同，如是我等九部之乘，不能等問如來智慧。
translation: It's like an elephant-horse jeweled chariot whose speed is different, and thus these nine of us vehicles can't equally question the Tathāgata's wisdom.

source_sentence: 又，文殊師利！
translation: Also, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 譬如金翅鳥王陵虛而飛，經由大海影現水中其身長大，水性之類莫能測量其形大小，
translation: It's like a golden-winged bird flying through the sky of a kingdom, passing through the shadow of the ocean and appearing to grow in water; no watery species can measure its size.

source_sentence: 如嬰兒病不堪大藥。」
translation: It's like a baby sickness that can't bear the great medicine.

source_sentence: 文殊師利言：「如純陀所說然，我為諸菩薩故，於甚深功德而立此論。」
translation: Mañjuśrī said, As explained by Cunda, it's because of the bodhisattvas that I establish this treatise in terms of profound merit.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊從其面門復放種種色光，文殊師利童子見此光明知如來泥洹時至，
translation: Then the World-honored One again emanated various rays of light from his face. Seeing these rays of light, Mañjuśrī the youthful knew that the time for the Buddha’s nirvana was approaching.

source_sentence: 便告長者純陀言：「汝為如來臨般泥洹施最後供，其時已到宜應速設。
translation: He then addressed the elder Cunda, saying, You're making the final offering for the Tathāgata when he approaches parinirvāṇa, and it's appropriate to quickly set up a place for him when he arrives.

source_sentence: 純陀！
translation: Cunda!

source_sentence: 當知如來不以無事而放光明，其義有以，宜速宜速，莫令失時如過採之華。」
translation: You should know that the Tathāgata doesn't radiate his light because of nothing; its meaning has a purpose, so it's advisable to do so quickly and quickly, so you won't lose time like a flower gathered in error.

source_sentence: 長者純陀默然而住。
translation: The elder Cunda remained silent.

source_sentence: 佛告純陀：「如來須臾泥洹，汝供養僧今正是時。」
translation: The Buddha told Cunda, The Tathāgata's momentary nirvāṇa is the right time for you to make offerings to the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 如是再三。
translation: He repeated it three times like this.

source_sentence: 純陀悵悢舉聲歎曰：「何其怪哉世間虛空，如來長逝悲號流淚。」
translation: Cunda, disheartened, raised his voice and praised him, What's so strange about the world and space that the Tathāgata has long passed away, weeping and wailing in pity.

source_sentence: 而復啟請願哀久住。
translation: He then again asked to be allowed to stay for a long time with pity.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「純陀！
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Cunda!

source_sentence: 汝莫啼哭自亂其心，當正思惟修野馬觀，芭蕉夢幻電光坏器等無有堅實，
translation: Don't weep or disturb your own mind, and you should correctly contemplate cultivating the observation of wild horses; plantains, illusions, lightning, and broken vessels have no solidity.

source_sentence: 當知有為為災患宅。」
translation: You should know that conditioned things are the house of disaster and distress.

source_sentence: 純陀白佛：「如來！
translation: Cunda said to the Buddha, Tathāgata!

source_sentence: 不哀住世，世間虛空，我等焉得而不啼哭？」
translation: If we don't grieve for the world, the world and space, how could we not weep?

source_sentence: 佛言：「純陀！
translation: The Buddha said, Cunda!

source_sentence: 今我哀汝及一切眾生而般泥洹，諸佛法爾，有為之法性亦復然。
translation: Now that I'm pitying you and all sentient beings for parinirvāṇa, the buddhas are likewise, and so is the Dharma nature of conditioned dharmas.

source_sentence: 汝於一切諸有為行，當思我昔說無常偈、苦偈、空偈、非我之偈，我說此身為災患偈，
translation: Regarding all conditioned things, think of the verses I spoken in the past on impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and non-self:

source_sentence: 如水上泡生滅之偈，莫但憂悲如凡人法。」
translation: It's like the verse on the arising and ceasing of bubbles in water, which doesn't simply express grief and sorrow as ordinary people do.

source_sentence: 純陀白佛：「如是，世尊！
translation: Cunda said to the Buddha, So it is, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 誠知如來方便泥洹，我故悲惱不能自持。」
translation: I truly know that the Tathāgata's skillful means are nirvāṇa, and because of my sorrow, I can't maintain it myself.

source_sentence: 佛告純陀：「善哉！
translation: The Buddha told Cunda, Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Excellent, good!

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 應知如來方便泥洹，當知佛經如涉大海，長壽非長壽，起法滅法幻法方便法，
translation: You should know that the Tathāgata enters nirvana through skillful means. You should know that the scriptures of the Buddha are like wading in the great ocean. Long life is not long life. They give rise to phenomena, cease phenomena, illusory phenomena, magical phenomena, and skillful means.

source_sentence: 時非時性非性，如是等盡應知。
translation: The nature of time and non-nature of time is neither time nor non-nature: such [things] as these should all be known.

source_sentence: 純陀！
translation: Cunda!

source_sentence: 汝欲疾度三有海者，可速設供，諸天人阿修羅所齎供具，今當得為最後供養，
translation: Those of you who wish to quickly cross the great sea of existence in the realm of desire, make offerings at once. The offerings brought by gods, humans, and asura demons will now be your last support.

source_sentence: 令一切眾生從我得不動快樂，汝及餘人值良福田，汝於如來等正覺所設檀波羅蜜，
translation: To cause all sentient beings to attain unshakable happiness from me, and that you and the others may find a good field of blessings, you set up the transcendent path of giving for the sake of the enlightened.

source_sentence: 不留難者亦當自成如來福田。」
translation: Those who don't leave difficulties will also become the Tathāgata's field of merit on their own.

source_sentence: 時純陀長者欲度一切眾生故，低頭泣淚猶如雨下，譬如日出照青樹葉赤脈悉現，
translation: When the elder Cunda wished to save all sentient beings, he bowed his head in tears and wept like rain. It was as if the rising sun were shining on the leaves of a blue tree whose leaves looked like red veins.

source_sentence: 純陀長者亦復如是，血淚俱下而白佛言：「唯然世尊！
translation: So it is with the elder Cunda, whose blood and tears flowed down his chest and said to the Buddha, Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今當從教。
translation: Now, we'll follow the teaching.

source_sentence: 然如來泥洹甚深之義，非我凡細所能測量，亦非聲聞緣覺所知，唯佛世尊智慧境界。」
translation: However, the profound meaning of the Tathāgata's nirvāṇa is not something we ordinary and subtle can measure, nor is it known by śrāvakas or pratyekbuddhas; it's only the sphere of the Bhagavān's wisdom.

source_sentence: 爾時純陀與諸眷屬，為度一切眾生故，稽首佛足右繞畢，燒香散華供養世尊，
translation: It was then that Cunda and his retinues, in order to save all sentient beings, bowed their heads at the Buddha’s feet, circumambulated him to his right, burned incense, scattered flowers, and offered support to the Worldhonored One.

source_sentence: 并復供養文殊師利，以供辦飯故還歸其家。
translation: They also made offerings to Mañjuśrī and returned home because they had prepared food for him.

translation: Mahāprajñāpāramitā-sūtra, Volume 1
